oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Discharge paper for Sgt. Charles Ward, Co. E, 60th Ind. Inf. Regt., USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sgt. Charles Ward served in Co. E. 60th Ind. Inf. Regt., USA. He enlisted on Feb. 1, 1862 and was discharged Dec. 5, 1864 for a disability. The document describes him as a blacksmith, 5'6" tall, with fair complexion, dark eyes and black hair. Born in 1841 in England, his family settled in Indiana. He later settled in White County, Ill. and died in 1920. There is wallpaper on back side of document. See also wmca091, wmca092 and wmca093.
